Events that occurred on 28 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 – After being diagnosed with trench fever the previous day, J.R.R. Tolkien is hospitalized.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 88.
1958 - C. S. Lewis writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 290.
1968 - Actor Stephen Hunter is born.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Joy Hill.
1988 - The Annotated Hobbit is first published in United States.
2006 - Author J.E.A. Tyler dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
T.A. 3019:
Nightfall: Gandalf and the four Hobbits reach Bree[1] and find out much has changed since they last were there.

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
